keyTakeAways: George Santos, a former U.S. Representative from New York, was released from prison after President Donald Trump commuted his seven-year sentence for fraud charges.
Santos claims his prosecution was not political and that he has 'had a very large slice of humble pie' during his incarceration.
Several Republican colleagues, including Rep. Nick LaLota and Rep. Andrew Garbarino, criticized Santos, saying he defrauded an election and showed no remorse.
Santos stated he is no longer required to pay fines, restitution, or probation and said he will do his best to comply with any legal obligations.
He expressed no intention of returning to politics within the next decade, calling himself 'all politicked out'.
Santos has expressed interest in prison reform, citing his experience in solitary confinement and suggesting that current prison systems contribute to recidivism.
Santos said he was in a 'chaotic ball of flames' during the time of his crimes and apologized to the public and his former district.
The commutation has sparked debate over political favoritism and the role of executive clemency in justice systems.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former U.S. Representative George Santos, convicted of fraud and serving a seven-year prison sentence, was released after President Donald Trump commuted his sentence. Santos claims the prosecution was not political and that he has learned humility during incarceration, despite criticism from fellow Republicans like Nick LaLota and Andrew Garbarino, who argue he defrauded an election and showed no remorse. Though he is no longer required to pay fines or restitution, Santos says he will do his best to comply with legal obligations. He expresses no plans to return to politics in the next decade and instead intends to focus on prison reform, citing his experience in solitary confinement. The release has sparked debate over political clemency and the fairness of sentencing in the criminal justice system.
title: George Santos maintains his prosecution was political, says he’s had a ‘very large slice of humble pie’
